website_summaries.verdict: Premium performance in an affordable oil filter. One of the best oil filters available for a variety of vehicles.
pros: Meant to filter out synthetic oil to keep it free of impurities and dirt
Good for a variety of engines, including several older models with more difficult-to-replace filters
cons: Large filter makes it difficult to use smaller wrenches for installation

customer_reviews.title: This filter is among the finest available.  My oil reports from Blackstone show fantastic filtration of oil.
customer_reviews.text: The Fram Ultra Synthetic is a superb filter. I sent in an oil sample from my 2006 GMC Duramax after 7200 miles and about 20 months, tow duty. The particulates in the oil sample were <0.1 percent and at the limit of the measuring equipment. Comment from Blackstone apart from being astonished at the condition of the motor as indicated by the oil was that the filter was doing an outstanding job. Hat tip to Fram, you get what you pay for, buy Fram top of the line and skip the $5 junk sold by this and other manufacturers. This filter has synthetic media, silicone anti drain back and easy grip cap. Sold all day long for $8 at WalMart.
customer_reviews.author: D. Martel

customer_reviews.title: Rock Solid Fram Ultra
customer_reviews.text: This is a Fram Ultra XG7317 with 24,362 miles using 3- OCI's of early 2015 vintage PYB 5w-20 conventional motor oil. From a 2014 Mitsubishi Outlander Sport AWD 2L CVT with no makeup oil through the process. Most driving is highway-rural. I ran this one out as my old 10K OCI's were showing I was throwing out perfectly good filters. This is overkill but shows you even with conventional oil these are the best filters on the market.
customer_reviews.author: JAmazon

customer_reviews.title: Only Fram I'll buy
customer_reviews.text: From what I can tell as a shade tree mechanic who has changed oil in a variety of vehicles for 50+ years, the Fram Ultra Synthetic is a top-of-the-line oil filter that compares favorably to other top brands. Appears to be very well made and has a quality silicon anti-drain back valve and filtering media designed for long-life synthetic oils. The SureGrip is a nice feature that may assist with removal, especially if access is tight. As to its claimed life of 15,000 miles, I'll never push things that far because good engine protection demands more frequent oil changes - even with synthetic oil and a quality filter changes in the 6,000 to 7,000 mile range are good insurance.
customer_reviews.author: TL

customer_reviews.title: Worst filter I ever seen
customer_reviews.text: After watching a U-Tube video I cut one apart. RUST fell out, the inside filter media went 1 3/4 around and the cylinder was CARDBOARD with a plastic coating, this was the new ONE! I removed the one from my car, 3000 miles drained it and cut the top off, the cardboard center which is the actual filter media had failed at the bottom allowing the oil to pass through without filtering it. I was blown away as I always thought Fram was a top of the line filter.
customer_reviews.author: Pat314

customer_reviews.title: Mediocre and cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: What I did not know until recently is that Fram uses cardboard inside their filters. As well, the amount of filter paper is among the least used compared to other manufacturers. Maybe that explains the relatively lower price. I'm not going back to Fram. Do the research for yourself on YouTube and see it for yourself. Though my car is almost 17 years old it's worth the extra few dollars for a higher quality filter. I'm done with Fram.
customer_reviews.author: Bad Rad

customer_reviews.title: Its FRAM
customer_reviews.text: Good quality filter with extended life (meaning that there is a less chance that the filter element will collapse on you and ruin your engine while you are trying to save money on oil changes). As online videos with filter cutaways prove, this is a good, solid filter, somewhat ahead of the crowd. It is not the super best, but it is made well enough to be realistically good. The synthetic just means it will remain uncollapsed longer. The filter cartridge inside is very well made and very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: I.T. Guy

customer_reviews.title: Works for about 5,000 mi - Be careful! WILL LEAK!
customer_reviews.text: If you plan to change your oil before you reach 5,000 miles, get this filter. If you forget to change your oil before 5,000 miles, you WILL see oil spraying everywhere from this filter. After about 6,000 miles the filter I purchased sprang two pinhole leaks and sprayed oil all over the lower part of my engine, cat, and exhaust. The pinholes sprung from the outer surface of the filter, not from the inside or threads. Terrible quality. It took three bottles of brake cleaner to clean everything. I cannot recommend an automotive product that has the reliability of a 1965 Maserati.
customer_reviews.author: J. V.

customer_reviews.title: started leaking after 400 miles on Honda accord  sports model 2015
customer_reviews.text: this is so bad I have been changing oil my self almost 7 years I know how to change the oil this is a very easy job for me I used this one first time on accord 2015 light came on after 4 00 miles I checked dipstick there was no engine oil that thing scared me i added oil and took my car to the dealer they told me filter was leaking don't buy this filter I don't trust it anymore I go for OEM filter or bosch brand
customer_reviews.author: kanwal

customer_reviews.title: Bad for your engine.
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy if you value your car. These filters are close to bottom shelf quality. Made of low quality materials and contain rust INSIDE of the filter! Guess where that rust goes? Into your engine! Go with a better quality filter like Napa/Wick or K&N. It’s truly money well spent compared to Fram filters. That is, if you care about your car...
customer_reviews.author: Bren

customer_reviews.title: Best filter to remove and throw away
customer_reviews.text: If you care for your engine, do not use FRAM filters. Buy two of them, cut one in half, look at the utter cheapness of how it is constructed (just paper!, like notebook paper!) and throw the other one away too. You will not want to put in on your car for more than a 1000 miles. Last option of filters. BUT, I love the rough coating that they put on there. Makes it a lot easier to throw away.
customer_reviews.author: Chekunda

customer_reviews.title: Great Honda Pilot Oil filter
customer_reviews.text: These are a very sturdy oil filter. Just holding one you can feel the quality and strength. They are easy to install and remove. I have been using them for around 4 years and I am very happy. These are nothing like the cheap orange fram filters. Recommended
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product and easily removable vice the OEM install
customer_reviews.text: I installed this product on my 2019 Honda Civic EX, which takes 0W-20 full synthetic, and is a perfect fit. After screwing the filter on, I tested whether it was easily removable and was easy with the grip feature built in. I will see how the filter performs after one year, but it seems that most, if not everyone, reviews seem rather positive. Hopefully the next time I need to remove the filter, it will be easier than the OEM installed filter. The latter is torqued on so much and has no grip to unscrew the filter. Plus, there is very limited room on the 10th generation Civic to even use tools to remove the filter.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Best filter out there for the money
customer_reviews.text: Fram... Wouldn't touch their cheaper filters but this ultra synthetic line is the best out there for the money. Well constructed and lasts for 2 changes (at 8k miles interval, total 16k) or one long interval (12-13k). Wouldn't push 20k tbh, oil just can't hang on that long with our gas quality state side.
customer_reviews.author: The smiley face on Amazon means A to Z -- CRAZY!

customer_reviews.title: Quality!
customer_reviews.text: I do my oil changes myself. And I use this or Mobil 1 Filters. Never liked FRAM until I heard this had a wire backed media! I probably don't need this for my 6ocik oci. But it makes me feel confident all the dirty is being trapped(placebo effect). Whats an extra few bucks for a quality filter for a car I want to keep for a long time! And the grippy texture will make it easy to remove next oil change! Will update on that.(Yes I did oil the gasket)
customer_reviews.author: SA

customer_reviews.title: The Flagship filter of FRAM. Flagship meaning... the only one you should get and buy from FRAM
customer_reviews.text: I bought this filter for value and design. It is also the best filter from FRAM's offering. Love the grip design... Easy to remove and install. I bought this along with Valvoline Synthetic They all went in my Infiniti QX80 Full Size SUV. Search me in Youtube: cbatilo if you wish to see a video of my oil change project.
customer_reviews.author: CBatilo

customer_reviews.title: One of the best
customer_reviews.text: I buy these or the K&N for my 2010 Honda CRV. These are a bit cheaper than the K&N, but just as good...maybe better. The go on and come off easily and they filter well. You can just use a gloved hand to turn them off due to the texturing. When I do the change, the oil comes out darker than new, but not even close to black. I use Mobil 1 full synthetic and change when the monitor gets down to 20%. Usually that is around 7500-8000 miles.
customer_reviews.author: brandonjlacy

customer_reviews.title: I've been using Fram Extra Guards for a few years ...
customer_reviews.text: I've been using Fram Extra Guards for a few years, but this size is difficult to find locally, and the Amazon price is (very slightly) less than local retail. The only issue with this particular filters- which is not a fault of this item at all but rather the stock design- is that it is of a rather small diameter, so a typical filter wrench won't grip it, although the rubberized coating does definitely help. I use a strap type wrench which will adjust down to fit.
customer_reviews.author: Charles P. Lotz

customer_reviews.title: Saves money in more than one way.
customer_reviews.text: I use these on my two teenage Nissans. A 1998 Pathfinder and a 2001 Maxima. I do all the oil changes and most maintenance/repairs on these cars and over the years this is the only filter I've used. No need to spend top dollar on a filter - unless you plan on not changing your oil for long intervals. I change twice a year - Spring and Fall. . The Pathfinder is currently at 198k miles. The Max is currently at 170k. Both are still running strong. This filter is quality at a reasonable price and keeps me car note free.
customer_reviews.author: 1 Man Army

customer_reviews.title: Missing gasket
customer_reviews.text: After I installed the filter and run the engine, I notice there is leakage around the filter. I took off the filter and found that the filter missed the rubber gasket. I checked the original package, but didn't find the gasket neither. I eventually bought another filter at a local store. Wasted the money on this.
customer_reviews.author: Jingjing Feng

customer_reviews.title: Not the average Fram
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my wife’s 2019 Subaru Ascent after several recommendations from the Subaru community. The Ultra Synthetic is in a totally different class from the orange or silver can Fram filters. This filter has steel end caps opposed to cardboard, a synthetic filter material and it is wire backed along with a silicone anti drain back valve. My wife runs her SUV hard and commutes every day in the South Carolina heat. Great filter.
customer_reviews.author: chris williams

customer_reviews.title: After watching Youtube videos on these - will never use again
customer_reviews.text: Go watch what these things look like on the inside. Trash.
customer_reviews.author: ByngSooner

customer_reviews.title: The friction of the base is very useful
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this item for my 2014 Honda CR-V synthetic oil. I will be updating the review after seeing how it copes/run for the next few months. One thing I do like about this filter is the base having a rough layer to help removing it. How much this layer actually helps will be found out when I am due for next oil change (most likely in 3 months or so).
customer_reviews.author: Saahil Khan

customer_reviews.title: Same Features at a Better Price
customer_reviews.text: Unlike some cheaper Fram filters, this one has the same specs as the more expensive brands but with a better price. Easy on and off without the need of a filter wrench is a nice Fram touch. If you use a good synthetic oil...get this filter for it.
customer_reviews.author: John HuffTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: It's an oil filter
customer_reviews.text: Installed these filters on the last few oil changes for my wife's Honda Pilot. Been replacing them on 5,000 mile intervals (despite them being rated for 20,000 miles) along with synthetic oil. Cheap insurance in my mind. Had engine oil analysis done and everything is running well and the engine has 225,000 miles on it now.
customer_reviews.author: AJ Tissier

customer_reviews.title: Solid filter at a good price.
customer_reviews.text: I always buy the best oil filter I can and then make a judgment call as to changing it every time I change oil. Sometimes I will skip a swap out once and change the higher capacity filter every other oil change. I don't put a lot of miles on my car and usually only need to change oil once per year. Knowing this filter is there doing its job makes me feel safer. Price is about the same as the big box stores and when combined with a big enough order I don't pay freight. Saves me going to the store and them not having my size or type in stock.
customer_reviews.author: Henry Wolford

customer_reviews.title: Does its job and is easy to service!
customer_reviews.text: Loved it! I change the oil on my 2003 Accord V6 every 3000 miles on the dot, and I've been experimenting with different filters each time. I'm getting the same performance out of this filter that I got out the previous ones. However I really like how this one's the only one that has a grip area to make it easier to remove! I don't have a filter wrench, I've always removed filters by hand, so these are awesome to work with!
customer_reviews.author: Gabe Doria

customer_reviews.title: Leaking oil.
customer_reviews.text: Installed in an 03 accord. This package arrived late and I had to buy one at a local store. My car started leaking oil and with some research I discovered this brand Dosent sell the best filters. Not even 100 miles on it and it started leaking. Best look for another filter or keep an eye on it if you get this one.
customer_reviews.author: Isaac

customer_reviews.title: No complaints from me
customer_reviews.text: I change my oil on my truck myself and very happy with this oil filter. NO issues, no leaks what so ever and is very similar to the OEM. I change the oil in my truck every 3000 miles with synthetic even though the oil filter can last longer. Very happy with the purchase and I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: The Don

customer_reviews.title: America’s most trusted brand
customer_reviews.text: Do you have a car you care just enough about to not buy the absolute cheapest oil filter for? This thing is for you. The textured top makes installation and removal a breeze and you can be like “I like Fram because of the commercials I watched in the 90’s and early 2000’s” and that will be that.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Nielsen

customer_reviews.title: Good price, good quality.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve seen various YouTube tear downs and these ToughGuard oil filters get a thumbs up from most everyone. The grip coating makes removal and installation much easier. I’ve never had one leave a deal behind, no leaks, no issues. We use the Fram TG filters on all three of our cars.
customer_reviews.author: J. Herr

customer_reviews.title: Great little filter
customer_reviews.text: Had to buy a new smaller oil wrench to get this filter off. Perhaps the one I put on will be easier to remove. This is probably more of the fault of the last “professional install”.
customer_reviews.author: RedRider189

customer_reviews.title: the right kind!
customer_reviews.text: These are great. Filter descriptions allow you to pick the exact one within the grouping that fit your car. There are 4 that are OK/will fit. Mine was the higher mile filter for 100% synthetic oil. It was nice to have more info besides – "it fits your car" Went on car with no trouble.
customer_reviews.author: JM_b17

customer_reviews.title: Love this filter!
customer_reviews.text: If you change your own oil this is the filter you need! Well made, and most of all, easy to install and REMOVE!
customer_reviews.author: L. Price

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using this same oil filter for over a year now and I have to get an oil change every 6-8 weeks. Car drives just as good as when I use more expensive oil filters. Works just as well.
customer_reviews.author: Sweetivr

customer_reviews.title: They're the Best Thing Going
customer_reviews.text: With that easy to handle black paint stuff they dip these things in, it is easy to screw on the unscrew from your engine. I don't know what all filter manufacturers don't make it easier for the home mechanic to change the oil the was From does.
customer_reviews.author: The Garth

customer_reviews.title: Well made, does the job
customer_reviews.text: Using this filter on a 2017 Mitsubishi Outlander. It’s well made and lasts. I’ve had no issues with these filters. Theycome off and go on easy, seal well, and filter for the required amount of time. All and all I’ll keep using these.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Davis

customer_reviews.title: Good, not great
customer_reviews.text: Installs just like any other oil filter. I’ve been checking the oil to see if it is staying cleaner at higher mileage levels, but to be honest I can’t tell that it’s any cleaner than the less expensive filter. Maybe it is and I just can’t tell it, but I’m a little disappointed. I’ll probably go back to the normal Fram filter
customer_reviews.author: Neil

customer_reviews.title: Great little filter and cannot beat the price and availability
customer_reviews.text: Great little filter and cannot beat the price and availability. Will sign up to receive them every six months (my oil change interval) once this one is deployed. Got to love the Subaru engine design with the filter on the top. Go get a Fumoto oil valve and you will start changing your own oil again!
customer_reviews.author: Auggie

customer_reviews.title: Fram Extra Guard a great treat for you engine
customer_reviews.text: Peace of mind. Fram Extra guard filter. If you care anything about your car or motor. Its best to use an great filter. An at a great price too. This is a great engine oil filter that gives great engine clean oil coverage.
customer_reviews.author: DRHimes

customer_reviews.title: I hope it will keep the synthetic oil cleaner since the stupid car goes by oil clearity not use
customer_reviews.text: Always preferred Fram filters. I hope it will keep the synthetic oil cleaner since the stupid car goes by oil clearity not use. My Honda wants a change of my Mobile 1 every 10,000 miles.
customer_reviews.author: William B. Shenefelt

customer_reviews.title: Work but not correct
customer_reviews.text: They work but they are not for this car Threads only engage 2 threads Threads are set back to far on filter
customer_reviews.author: Jeff P.

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement for OEM
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these filters for my wife's 2009 Honda Civic. They perform flawlessly, and I love the textured grip on them that make changing the filter a breeze. I haven't noticed any change in performance, and these work just as well as any other filter that I've used on the car. I've been using these filters for over 3 years now and have yet to have one single issue, buy with confidence.
customer_reviews.author: Range Brover

customer_reviews.title: Subscribe and Save usually offers the best price.
customer_reviews.text: The Fram Ultra Synthetic line of filters are their premium items and are comparable to any other premium filter on the market. Compare the Amazon price with your local Walmart. Subscribe and Save usually offers the best price.
customer_reviews.author: S. Donnelly

customer_reviews.title: long last
customer_reviews.text: My 2013 Honda Civic require changing oil and filter every 5000 miles. I always use better oil and filter and change them every 10000miles. Last time I found my car not performance well at 8000 miles with Honda OEM filter but same oil. Now my car goes well on 9000miles now with this filter.
customer_reviews.author: fish

customer_reviews.title: Good grip on top and quality oil filter
customer_reviews.text: Don’t get upsold on oil filters. These are as good as any high dollar ones and I have not ruined an engine yet! Always do my own oil and the grip at the top makes them easy to install
customer_reviews.author: Matt Jolivet

customer_reviews.title: Not the black filter, but the new improved orange filter
customer_reviews.text: No idea why amazon shows a black version of this filter...I received the standard orange sure grip extra guard. Either way I’ll be using this filter for my wife’s Honda. Can’t really go wrong with fram filters, they do produce most of the Oem oil filters on the market. Good filtering specs and a good affordable price.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: A great filter and easy to use. A very good quality filter - the only ones I use. The grip feature makes them easy to install and handle. Highly recommend Fram filters.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Better than the picture
customer_reviews.text: The filter I received did not look like the one in the picture. The one I got was actually much nicer. The end was wrapped in rubber or silicon and it made it really easy to put on and I am sure it will remove easily as well. Well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Vidal

customer_reviews.title: like the Fram filters
customer_reviews.text: Fram filters are go-to filter for me. never had problems, and like the "grippy" top, which makes them easier to grip (especially when using rubber glove) to screw on and off.
customer_reviews.author: Leon

customer_reviews.title: Best Brand for any type of filters for Car.
customer_reviews.text: FRAM is my favorite brand for Any type of filters for car. It’s cheaper and great than other Brands. Amazon has lowest price than other big retailers. Will definitely recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: utpal

customer_reviews.title: Easy to remove
customer_reviews.text: I normally use the Fram orange can (cheapest version), but reviews here made me 2x-think that. Fit and finish was fine, as-expected. Fits 2005 Honda Odyssey Touring.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Fram is the only filter I use!
customer_reviews.text: Fram is a solid product and trusted name. Ever since I owned a vehicle I have used fram oil filters combined with pennzoil. Highly recommend it over all the other competitors in the oil filter market.
customer_reviews.author: Chad

customer_reviews.title: Protection now.
customer_reviews.text: It installs as advertised and for the time being I have to take the claims of extra protection on faith. We'll see about the long run as time goes on, but I fundamentally believe in spending a few extra bucks per oil change, etc, vs. a few extra thousand when an engine fails.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Bill

customer_reviews.title: Best product reliable and cheap
customer_reviews.text: I am on my fourth order of FRAM Oil Filter now and I have to say that I have no problem with the product at all. It is reliable, oil doesn't leak, and my car performance cannot be better. I would recommend this product to anyone. FYI, I use it on my Honda Civic 2012 EX-L.
customer_reviews.author: My Truong

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend on 2008 Honda Accord
customer_reviews.text: Oil consumption seemed to increase when using this filter on my 08 Honda Accord. Decided to replace it early as I didn't want to risk any damage due to oil starvation. Would not purchase again. Rather spend a bit more for a Mobil 1, which, both in my experience and any Youtube video on the subject, has better filtration and lasts longer.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Pagano

customer_reviews.title: It's an Oil Filter
customer_reviews.text: Many people have specific brand preferences for their car's oil filter. I have used Fram for years without issue. These are normal Fram filters at an affordable price.
customer_reviews.author: D. K. Lawson

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: How do you review this. I have used them in the past and know the end makes it easier to remove off my truck. It was cheaper on Amazon then at my local automotive store.
customer_reviews.author: David Agpalo

customer_reviews.title: The best synthetic filter on the market.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit for my 2007 accord 2.4 I believe this is the best filter on the market for synthetic oil. I’ve been using Fram products for over 20 years. The grip on it allows you to remove it by hand.
customer_reviews.author: Gerard B.

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Filter and a Good Price from Amazon
customer_reviews.text: For a do-it-yourselfer, Fram makes it easy. I have never had an issue with any Fram filter and I have been using them for 25+ years. Also, I've run my cars to 130,000+ miles and never ever had an engine issue. I've asked a pro mechanic about that, and his answer: you have not always purchased a great car, but you've always taken care of what you purchased. Fram has helped me do just that.
customer_reviews.author: David Roddick

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: It's an oil filter, it filters oil. I do particularly like Fram filters for the grippy texture on the back of the filter. Makes removal much nicer.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: They get the job done.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used Fram Tough Guard oil filters in Toyota, Honda, and Chevy vehicles for more than 300k combined miles. So far, so good! They work as expected and are easier to install due to the textured grip around the filter.
customer_reviews.author: GR4

customer_reviews.title: Easiest filter to install in the worst situation
customer_reviews.text: I can't tell you enough how much of a pain it was to get the old oil filter out. On a honda accord that is lowered a bit is a tight but manageable. You will need either a very silm forearm or a prying tool to get off old ones and the newer ones clicks into place like magic. Just remember to put oil into the filter before installing.
customer_reviews.author: Roberto Romero

customer_reviews.title: Good filter but
customer_reviews.text: Is a good filter, but is tricky to install and remove since it has magnetic. It can be dangerous if didn't install correctly first time, and didn't properly remove the ring before reinstalling.
customer_reviews.author: Zuhao

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Great oil filter and the price is right. I use with Mobile 1 full synthetic oil and can go one year between oil changes with moderate use on my Honda Odyssey and Nissan Altima.
customer_reviews.author: robert polsunas

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for 2012 Subaru Forester X with FB25 engine
customer_reviews.text: I just did my oil change and this filter is perfect for my 2012 Subaru Forester with the FB25 engine. Very easy for remove and install.
customer_reviews.author: Humberto Ginesta

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: This was the best price I found for a frame oil filter. Since this purchase I've opted for a cheaper filter without the grip.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Berneski

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, handy grip.
customer_reviews.text: It’s good, hand grip on the filter makes it easy to remove if you don’t install it too hard on initial install. Filter itself is high quality, YouTube has some videos comparing all different filters and this one was top rated.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Thach

customer_reviews.title: Sample the D*&! Oil.
customer_reviews.text: Well... I didn't actually sample the oil for contaminants, but upon installation it simply glides on with ease. When taking it off it unscrews just as it should.
customer_reviews.author: JJVJ

customer_reviews.title: 06 acura
customer_reviews.text: I love how it looks. Of course its not seen but looks nice when I work on the car and I see it. Works well, fits, no problems. Got it for the for the 2nd time for an oil change and will be getting it again
customer_reviews.author: Luis Herrera

customer_reviews.title: The screws matched up are used a little lube for easy gliding
customer_reviews.text: Don’t know I’ll have to ask my car When threading I went nice and slow put a little lube around gasket for easy gliding
customer_reviews.author: DO DUDE

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Tough as it comes. Once a year replacement for my Oddy and Maxima. Never failed on me before and don't expect anything less.
customer_reviews.author: Saher Rashid

customer_reviews.title: Solid, well built.  Good for 2007 Honda Pilot
customer_reviews.text: Appears very solid, well built, and fairly heavy. I feel good about it,installed perfectly on 2007 Honda Pilot EX. 209,000 miles, Mobil 1 high mileage oil -
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Love Fram
customer_reviews.text: Since I was 16 years old, never had one fail. 22 years is enough proof that you can trust Fram. Always a customer, always have my engines last very long time, in fact never had a motor fail on me yet!
customer_reviews.author: premier620

customer_reviews.title: Good filter without breaking the bank. Major brand name too
customer_reviews.text: Fram filters are a solid brand and consistent. The sure grip has never worked for me but neither has any other brand. I always end up using a wrench. There are cheaper filters but I feel like these are what you pay for
customer_reviews.author: MarzanoMaker

customer_reviews.title: Good Buy
customer_reviews.text: At 68 yrs old I still change the oil in our Honda Odyssey. I don't trust the children at Walmart and other fast oil change facilities to do it. I've heard too many horror stories. Besides your price beats anything locally. I even buy my Mobile 1 synthetic oil from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Works good so far.
customer_reviews.text: I've been using Fram for a long time,I believe these filters are a step up from the ones used for regular oil.
customer_reviews.author: ROBERT S YACZKO

customer_reviews.title: Its a Fram Ultra - good to go....
customer_reviews.text: Great filter for the money. Fits in my application (replacing a shorter XG6607 filter) on my '14 Rogue SL.
customer_reviews.author: S. Hood

customer_reviews.title: Best filter for synthetic oil!
customer_reviews.text: This is the only oil filter that I use for my synthetic motor oil. I have used this style filter for several different vehicles and I have never had an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Cody Kamrowski

customer_reviews.title: Did not fit!
customer_reviews.text: Looked nice, but did not fit the vehicle ordered for, so I'll just give it one star! Thanks for the extra aggravation!
customer_reviews.author: NoRelation

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality and price ..
customer_reviews.text: Arrive on time very well packed. They are equal to the description. super comfortable. excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: RICARDO THEVENIN

customer_reviews.title: Regular purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Husband loves that I can order these online instead of him having to travel all over to find them.
customer_reviews.author: Jane L.

customer_reviews.title: No Need For A Mechanic
customer_reviews.text: This product was an extremely useful buy. It arrived very promptly and was packaged with plenty of information that is important to know for "at-home" oil changes. I personally change my filter every 3,000 miles because of my daily usage, but it is well over 5,000 miles and my filter is still completely useable. Will continue to purchase for each oil change. :)
customer_reviews.author: Monique Brantome

customer_reviews.title: ... ( got filters at wal-mart) for many years and pleased with performance
customer_reviews.text: Been using Fram filters on my 3 cars ( got filters at wal-mart) for many years and pleased with performance. Got them cheaper than Wally worlds price and did not have do drive 20 miles R/T. Use this filter on my 06 honda accord 4 cylinder, almost 200,000 miles changing oil & filter every 7 k miles other cars have only had Fram filters since I bought them new.
customer_reviews.author: F15-Eagle Chief

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement for OEM
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit and you know we can trust the name. Never had a problem and item is inexpensive at Amazon.com.
customer_reviews.author: WOLF F.

customer_reviews.title: Better packaging required
customer_reviews.text: Product is good. Fits like OE Fram quality Packaged with the oil, handling caused oil to leak all over inside of packaging Very Messy
customer_reviews.author: Vernon Campbell

customer_reviews.title: The bottom part is easy to grip with hands
customer_reviews.text: I always use frame filters for my Honda Civic. The bottom part is easy to grip with hands. No special tool needed! And the price is really good for the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Murat

customer_reviews.title: fit right it
customer_reviews.text: just got change oil few day agoby myself. it work as it is! easy change in and out! I think It will work well!
customer_reviews.author: Skyscanner

customer_reviews.title: Made in USA. Honda CRV 2019
customer_reviews.text: Works great for 2019 Honda CRV. Check Fram website for the correct model number. Made in USA.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Cheaper than wally world and didn't have to make a trip. Worked on my 02 frontier 3.3 v6.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy B.

customer_reviews.title: Sure, why not?
customer_reviews.text: It fit the car but who really knows what is happening inside? I sure don't. Hopefully large chunks of metal aren't re-entering the engine after the filter.
customer_reviews.author: roostertail

customer_reviews.title: Tried it and was the wrong size
customer_reviews.text: Tried it and could not get it to fit. I believe it was the wrong size for my vehicle.
customer_reviews.author: AMZ Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Premium oil filter
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install/remove with grip surface on end of filter. No problems with leakage like I've had with other filters.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen

customer_reviews.title: Oil filter
customer_reviews.text: It's an oil filter lol It does what it needs to! And it was easy to put in.

customer_reviews.title: Works!
customer_reviews.text: The filter does what it suppose to. I haven't had any issues. I hand tightened the filter with ease.
customer_reviews.author: howdiggity

customer_reviews.title: Quality Filter
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this filter, I'm running this on a 2015 Honda Accord with HPS royal purple.
customer_reviews.author: smilebrightrado

customer_reviews.title: Worked
customer_reviews.text: Bought a new Car and this filter fits the 2015 CRV. Old man that just likes to change his own oil. Filter fits good and is good sealer
customer_reviews.author: Half Hitch

customer_reviews.title: It's an oil filter, it's a Fram. That's about all you need to know.
customer_reviews.text: It's a Fram, what else do you need to know? You're not gonna do much better for the price.
customer_reviews.author: J.

customer_reviews.title: Good price.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty much what you look for. It is quite difficult to review the technical effectiveness of it (does it clean it better than others? etc.) as one would probably need an expert judgment and lots of precise experiments to see the results.
customer_reviews.author: KSKN

customer_reviews.title: very good price
customer_reviews.text: We all know it's not the best but good enough good price good bang for your buck
customer_reviews.author: Adrian

customer_reviews.title: Great filter
customer_reviews.text: I've tried several different brands when these aren't available for one reason or another, and I have always had an issue getting them back off when it comes time for a change. These are easy to thread on and off by hand and what I always recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

product_meta.title: FRAM Ultra Synthetic XG7317, 20K Mile Change Interval Spin-On Oil Filter with SureGrip
product_meta.description: Style:Ultra SyntheticFRAM Ultra Synthetic Oil Filters with SureGrip is the proven leader in ultimate engine protection for today's cars and light duty trucks. Ultra Synthetic is engineered for drivers who require maximum engine protection and use synthetic motor oils for extended 20,000 mile change intervals. This high capacity, high efficiency filter delivers peak performance. No matter what you drive, or what motor oil you use, FRAM has a filter for you.
feature_bullets: Ultra Synthetic is the filter for consumers looking to get the most out of their investment in full synthetic oil
Proven extended protection up to 20,000 miles
99%+ dirt removal efficiency at greater than 20 microns
Dual layered, synthetic media reinforced with a metal screen traps and holds dirt and extends the life of the filter
SureGrip anti-slip texture makes changing FRAM oil filters quick and easy

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.8 out of 5 stars3,050 ratings4.8 out of 5 stars
